def_en: If you talk about a particular kind of thing, you are talking about one of the types or sorts of that thing.
If you refer to someone's kind, you are referring to all the other people that are like them or that belong to the same class or set.

def_cn: 各种类型的；五花八门的
def_en: You can use all kinds of to emphasize that there are a great number and variety of particular things or people.
You use kind of when you want to say that something or someone can be roughly described in a particular way.

def_cn: 名不副实，徒有其名（指不如本应有的那么好）
def_en: You can use of a kind to indicate that something is not as good as it might be expected to be, but that it seems to be the best that is possible or available.
If you refer to someone or something as one of a kind, you mean that there is nobody or nothing else like them.

def_cn: 两个/三个/四个同一类的
def_en: If you refer, for example, to two, three, or four of a kind, you mean two, three, or four similar people or things that seem to go well or belong together.
If you respond in kind, you react to something that someone has done to you by doing the same thing to them.

def_cn: 以实物支付；以货代款；以服务偿付
def_en: If you pay a debt in kind, you pay it in the form of goods or services and not money.

def_cn: 慈祥的；体贴的；乐于助人的
def_en: Someone who is kind behaves in a gentle, caring, and helpful way towards other people.

def_cn: 请…，…可以吗（表示坚定且客气地请求某人做某事）
def_en: You can use kind in expressions such as please be so kind as to and would you be kind enough to in order to ask someone to do something in a firm but polite way.

def_cn: 突出优点的；使胜过实物的
def_en: Something that is kind emphasizes the good qualities in something, and perhaps makes it appear better than it really is.
kindly; kindness;
